intro: Chloranthus holostegius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandworts, is a member of the Chloranthaceae family. It is a flowering plant characterized by its small, greenish-yellow flowers and opposite, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a compact growth habit and produces fruits that are capsule-like in structure. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
